articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: EU leaders back new military spending plans at Ukraine summit - The Associated Press
articles.description: European Union leaders committed to a massive step in defense cooperation following decades of hesitation, spurred on by President Donald Trump’s announcement that U.S. was suspending aid to Ukraine.
articles.content: The EUs 27 leaders have finished a working lunch with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. Meal-time discussions are unscripted, and the heads of state and government can freely speak, often in E… [+1017 chars]
